intro: Tetracme bucharica, commonly known as the Bukharan tetracme, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, often in shades of yellow or green. Despite its ecological significance, it is relatively understudied in modern botanical research.
